clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of Subcutaneous Versus Intravenous Palonosetron in Cancer Treated With Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Crossover Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of Subcutaneous (SC) Versus Intravenous Palonosetron in Cancer Patients Treated With Platinum Based Chemotherapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Clinica Universidad de Navarra, Universidad de Navarra

clinical_study.source: Clinica Universidad de Navarra, Universidad de Navarra

brief_summary.textblock: This trial compares the pharmacokinetics of palonosetron administered subcutaneously and intravenously.

detailed_description.textblock: 5-Hydroxitryptamine3 antagonists are one of the mainstays of antiemetic treatment and they are administered either intravenously or orally. Nevertheless sometimes neither administration route is feasible, such as in patients unable to admit oral intake managed in an outpatient setting. Our objective is to evaluate the bioavailability of subcutaneous palonosetron.Patients receiving platinum-based chemotherapy will be randomized to receive palonosetron 3 mg either subcutaneously or intravenously in a crossover manner during two cycles. Blood and urine samples will be collected after each cycle. Pharmacokinetics of subcutaneous and IV palonosetron will be prospectively compared.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the pharmacokinetics of a single dose of palonosetron 3mg administered either subcutaneously or intravenously by assessment of area under the curve and Cmax in cancer patients treated with emetogenic chemotherapy.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Palonosetron levels will be assessed at 10 , 15, 30, 45, 60 min. and 12 and 24 hours following treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare the efficacy of a single dose of palonosetron 3mg administered either subcutaneously or intravenously by assessment of number of episodes of nausea and vomiting in cancer patients treated with emetogenic chemotherapy.

intervention.description: Palonosetron 3 mg administered SC or IV
